summary: A try-statement provides a mechanism for catching exceptions thrown in a section of code.
details: The try-catch block must have at least one handler.
The scope of the variablei is anywhere in the enclosing function.
The variablei is alive precisely during an activation of the enclosing function.
The compiler will automatically reorder the handlers based on their specificity.
A handler X is more specific than a handler Y, if typeX is a subclass of typeY.
checks: The variablei cannot share its name with another variable declared in the same scope.
The type of typei must be assignable to type java.lang.Throwable.
No two types in the same try-statement can be equal.
